books.title: Heretics
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: A collection of essays in which G. K. Chesterton debates the intellectuals of his day on a range of topics.

books.title: After London
books.author: Richard Jefferies
books.summary: A young man tries to understand his place in the world as he explores a post-apocalyptic England.

books.title: Pointed Roofs
books.author: Dorothy M. Richardson
books.summary: Seventeen-year-old Miriam Henderson is sent to Germany to teach English at a finishing school in Hanover.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: The Story of the Amulet
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Four children are reunited with an ancient, magical creature and go on adventures through time with a magic amulet.

books.title: Love Among the Chickens
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Stanley Ukridge ensnares the narrator in another one of his schemes: running a chicken farm in the English countryside.

books.title: Richard II
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: King Richard II’s wasteful spending habits drive his supporters to revolt.

books.title: Kai Lung’s Golden Hours
books.author: Ernest Bramah
books.summary: An ancient Chinese storyteller charged with treason uses his beguiling tales to avoid conviction.

books.title: Some Do Not …
books.author: Ford Madox Ford
books.summary: As World War I looms, a stiff English statistician and a suffragette fall in love.

books.title: The House on the Borderland
books.author: William Hope Hodgson
books.summary: An account of the terrifying metaphysical haunting of a recluse’s secluded home.

books.title: Roughing It
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain’s semiautobiographical account of his travel across the United States.

books.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: The world’s first consulting detective and his companion investigate further crimes and mysteries.

books.title: The National Being
books.author: George William Russell
books.summary: An Irish writer presents his vision of an independent Irish nation.

books.title: The Rights of Man
books.author: Thomas Paine
books.summary: A philosopher and political activist presents a forceful argument in favor of the principles of the French Revolution and of republicanism in general, together with a condemnation of monarchy and hereditary power in general.

books.title: Mirèio
books.author: Frédéric Mistral
books.summary: Two young Provençal lovers are kept apart by their social class.

books.title: Where Angels Fear to Tread
books.author: E. M. Forster
books.summary: After an English widow on holiday impetuously falls in love with a handsome young Tuscan, her panicked in-laws send a rescue party.

books.title: Triplanetary
books.author: E. E. Smith
books.summary: In a universe where all powerful alien races influence the fates of worlds, a war erupts between the Triplanetary League of the inner solar system, pirates led by a mysterious and malicious scientist, and technologically advanced aliens.

books.title: The Law of the Four Just Men
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: A group of wealthy vigilantes continue their quest to bring justice to those criminals beyond the reach of conventional law.

books.title: Gitanjali
books.author: Rabindranath Tagore
books.summary: Prose poems of offering translated by the author from the original Bengali.

books.title: Essays
books.author: Henry David Thoreau
books.summary: A collection of Henry David Thoreau’s essays.
